SPELLBOOK.Analytics.ClearDataContent: This will permanently delete all spell usage data. This cannot be undone!
SPELLBOOK.Analytics.ImportWarningMessage: This will overwrite existing spell data for these users.
SPELLBOOK.Analytics.TrackingDisabled: Spell usage tracking is disabled. Right-click to enable.
SPELLBOOK.Analytics.TrackingEnabled: Spell usage tracking is enabled. Right-click to disable.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.LevelUpModern: You've leveled up! You can now learn new cantrips and unlearn one of your existing cantrips.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.LockedLegacy: Cantrips cannot be unlearned with legacy rules.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.LockedOutsideLevelUp: Cantrips can only be changed during level-up under these rules.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.LockedOutsideLongRest: Cantrips can only be changed during a long rest under these rules.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.MaximumReached: You've reached your maximum number of cantrips
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.MustUnlearnFirst: You must unlearn a cantrip before learning a new one
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.OnlyOneSwap: You've already swapped one cantrip. You must complete this swap before making another.
SPELLBOOK.Cantrips.WizardRuleOnly: This rule is only available for Wizard characters
SPELLBOOK.Chat.UpdateReport.Title: {name} - Update Report
SPELLBOOK.Comparison.NoSpellsSelected: Select spells to compare by clicking the 'Compare' links
SPELLBOOK.Errors.FailedToLoad: Failed to load spell data. Please try again.
SPELLBOOK.Filters.Materials.Title: Material Components
SPELLBOOK.FocusSettings.DescriptionToolt: Description shown to users when selecting this focus
SPELLBOOK.FocusSettings.Name: Name
SPELLBOOK.FocusSettings.NameTooltip: The display name for this focus type
SPELLBOOK.FocusSettings.ResetDialog.Cont: This will reset all focus types to the default magical archetypes and clear all character focus assignments.
SPELLBOOK.Loadouts.ClassInfo: Manage {class} spell loadouts. Currently {count} spells prepared.
SPELLBOOK.Loadouts.ConfirmDeleteContent: Are you sure you want to delete the loadout "{name}"? This cannot be undone.
SPELLBOOK.Loadouts.ManageLoadouts: Manage Spell Loadouts (right click to quick-select)
SPELLBOOK.Loadouts.NoLoadouts: No loadouts saved. Create your first loadout by preparing spells and clicking "Save Current".
SPELLBOOK.Loadouts.NoSpellsPrepared: No spells are currently prepared to save
SPELLBOOK.LongRest.SwapAvailableNotifica: {name} can now make spell changes for: {classes}
SPELLBOOK.LongRest.SwapPromptIntro: Your long rest is complete! The following classes can now make changes to their spells:
SPELLBOOK.Migrations.Apology: If you encounter any issues, please report them on the module's GitHub page.
SPELLBOOK.Migrations.ChatDescription: The following data has been migrated or updated:
SPELLBOOK.Migrations.CustomSpellListForm: Migrated spell list format for {count} actors
SPELLBOOK.Migrations.NullToArrayMigratio: Updated default spell list values for {count} actors
SPELLBOOK.Migrations.SuppressConfirm: Are you sure you want to suppress future migration warnings? You can re-enable them in the module settings.
SPELLBOOK.Notices.ClassNotFromCompendium: Class '{className}' is not from a compendium pack. Your DM must use a class from a pack for proper handling.
SPELLBOOK.Notifications.OverLimitWarning: You are preparing {current} {type} (limit: {max}). GM will be notified.
SPELLBOOK.Party.Analysis.MaterialCostToo: Spells with costly material components that are consumed
SPELLBOOK.Party.Analysis.SomaticTooltip: Spells requiring somatic components - need free hands
SPELLBOOK.Party.Analysis.TotalPreparedTo: Total spells currently prepared by the party
SPELLBOOK.Party.Analysis.TotalSpellsTool: Total unique spells known across all party members
SPELLBOOK.Party.Analysis.VerbalTooltip: Spells requiring verbal components - can be silenced
SPELLBOOK.Party.AskGMToSetParty: Ask your GM to set up a primary party group actor to use party spell features.
SPELLBOOK.Party.FilterToMember: Click to filter spells for this member
SPELLBOOK.Party.NoPrimaryPartySet: No primary party set. Please configure a primary party group actor in D&D 5e system settings.
SPELLBOOK.Party.OpenPartyManager: Open Party Spell Manager (right click to enable Party Mode)
SPELLBOOK.Party.Recommendations.Duplicat: Multiple party members have prepared the same spells - consider coordination
SPELLBOOK.Party.Recommendations.HighConc: High concentration spell usage - consider diversifying with non-concentration options
SPELLBOOK.Party.Recommendations.LimitedD: Limited damage type diversity - consider preparing spells with different damage types
SPELLBOOK.Party.Recommendations.LimitedS: Limited saving throw diversity - enemies may exploit consistent weaknesses
SPELLBOOK.Party.Recommendations.LowLevel: Party is heavily weighted toward low-level spells - consider higher level options
SPELLBOOK.Party.Recommendations.LowRitua: Low ritual spell utilization - consider preparing more ritual spells for out-of-combat utility
SPELLBOOK.Party.Recommendations.Unbalanc: Unbalanced spellcasting focuses - consider diversifying party roles
SPELLBOOK.Preload.GMPartyReady: Spell Book ready for party! ({actors} actors, {spells} spells loaded)
SPELLBOOK.Preload.GMSetupReady: Spell Book ready for GM setup! ({lists} lists, {spells} spells)
SPELLBOOK.Preload.PlayerReady: Your Spell Book is ready! ({spells} spells loaded)
SPELLBOOK.Preparation.AlwaysTooltip: This spell is always prepared and doesn't count against your prepared spell limit
SPELLBOOK.Preparation.AtWillTooltip: This spell can be cast at will and doesn't require preparation
SPELLBOOK.Preparation.ClassAtMaximum: You've reached your maximum number of {class} spells
SPELLBOOK.Preparation.InnateTooltip: This spell is innate and doesn't require preparation
SPELLBOOK.Preparation.RitualTooltip: This spell can be ritually cast.
SPELLBOOK.Registry.ToggleTooltip: Add this spell list to the registry. This is used by other modules and the Compendium Browser to assign specific spells to specific lists.
SPELLBOOK.ScrollProcessor.ResultsFooter: All scrolls found in compendiums are listed above.
SPELLBOOK.Scrolls.NotPreparable: Scroll spells cannot be prepared, only learned.
SPELLBOOK.Search.AdvancedSyntaxSupport: Search spells with advanced syntax support
Single character to trigger advanced search mode. Must not be a letter or number. Common symbols: ^ ! @ # $ % & * + = ? ~ | \ / < >
SPELLBOOK.Settings.AutoDeleteUnpreparedS: When enabled, automatically removes unprepared prepared-casting spells from character sheets after saving. This cleans up spells that were manually unprepared through the system UI.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.CPRCompatibility.Hint: When enabled, automatically runs CPR automation setup after spells are added to character sheets.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.CPRCompatibility.Name: Cauldron of Plentiful Resources Compatibility
SPELLBOOK.Settings.CantripPreparationBon: Bonus to the number of cantrips this class can prepare. Can be negative to reduce the base amount.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.CantripScaleValues.Hi: Comma-separated list of scale value keys to check for cantrip limits. The system will use the first matching key found. Add custom keys for homebrew classes as needed. WARNING: syntax errors may break this module, follow identifer rules.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.CantripSwapping.Hint: When this class can swap cantrips
SPELLBOOK.Settings.CantripSwapping.Label: Cantrip Swapping
SPELLBOOK.Settings.ClassRules.Descriptio: Configure spellcasting rules for each class individually.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.ClassRules.Title: Per-Class Rules
SPELLBOOK.Settings.CompendiumSelectionHi: Select which compendiums to include in spell indexing for better performance
SPELLBOOK.Settings.CompendiumSelectionIn: Select which compendiums should be indexed for spell searching. Reducing the number of indexed compendiums will improve performance, especially with large compendium collections. Note: If you do not select any spell compendiums, this module will not function correctly.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.CompendiumSelectionPe: Changes take effect after reload. Large collections will take time to index.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.ConsumeScrollsWhenLea: Whether spell scrolls should be consumed when learning spells from them in the wizard Spell Book.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.CustomSpellLists.Hint: Select additional spell lists to merge with the base class list. Multiple selections will be combined automatically.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.CustomSpellMappings.H: Mappings between original and custom spell lists
SPELLBOOK.Settings.DeductSpellLearningCo: Automatically deduct gold from the character when learning spells for their spellbook. The cost per spell level can be configured per-class in the Spellbook Settings.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.DefaultEnforcementBeh: How spell selection rules should be enforced by default
Display spell components (V, S, M, etc.)
Control what metadata is displayed across the module.
Customize which UI elements and metadata are displayed in spell lists
SPELLBOOK.Settings.DisableLongRestSwapPr: Disable the dialog prompt that appears after a long rest when characters can swap spells or cantrips. The Spell Book will still be available for swapping.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.DisabledNoScaleValue: Disabled because no cantrip scale value was found for this class.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.EnableSpellUsageTrack: Track spell usage for analytics. Disable this during mock sessions or combat tests.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.EnforcementBehavior.H: How strictly to enforce spellcasting rules
SPELLBOOK.Settings.FilterConfiguration.H: Configure which filters are enabled and their display order
SPELLBOOK.Settings.FilterInstructions: Enable or disable filters using checkboxes. Drag filters with grip handles to reorder them. Some filters have fixed positions and cannot be moved.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.FixedPositionDesc: This filter has a fixed position
SPELLBOOK.Settings.ForceWizardMode.Hint: Treat this class as a wizard, enabling wizard Spell Book functionality including spell copying, ritual casting from Spell Book, and Spell Book management. This creates a separate wizard Spell Book for this class.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.ForceWizardMode.Label: Force Wizard Mode
SPELLBOOK.Settings.HiddenSpellLists.Hint: Spell lists that have been hidden from view to reduce clutter.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.HiddenSpellLists.Name: Hidden Spell Lists
SPELLBOOK.Settings.IndexedCompendiumsHin: Configure which compendiums are indexed for spell searching to improve performance.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.InjectNotesIntoDescri: Automatically inject your personal spell notes into the descriptions of spells on your character sheet.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Logger.Hint: Set the level of logs generated by Spell Book. The troubleshooter will catch everything regardless. Recommended: Warnings.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Logger.Name: Logging Level
SPELLBOOK.Settings.NoCompendiumsConfigur: You have no indexed compendiums set in Spell Book. Configure them now to avoid unnecessary loading times.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.NoScaleValueNotice: No cantrip scale value found, cantrips disabled for this class.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.NotesMaxLength.Hint: Maximum number of characters allowed in spell notes. Can be adjusted by the GM.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.NotesMaxLength.Name: Maximum Note Length
SPELLBOOK.Settings.PartyModeTokenLimit.H: Maximum number of party member tokens to show per spell in Party Mode to avoid UI clutter
Spell lists enabled for D&D 5e SpellListRegistry integration
SPELLBOOK.Settings.RitualCasting.Hint: How this class can cast ritual spells
SPELLBOOK.Settings.RitualCasting.Label: Ritual Casting
SPELLBOOK.Settings.RuleSetOverride.Hint: Override the global rule set for this character
SPELLBOOK.Settings.RuleSetOverride.Label: Rule Set Override
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SetupMode.Hint: When enabled, GMs preload all spells and spell lists for full access during setup. When disabled, GMs preload nothing to save memory.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SetupMode.Name: GM Setup Mode
SPELLBOOK.Settings.ShowCantrips.Hint: Whether to display cantrips for this class
SPELLBOOK.Settings.ShowCantrips.Label: Show Cantrips
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SidebarControlsBottom: Position the sidebar control buttons at the bottom of the sidebar instead of the top
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SpellBookPosition.Hin: Config only setting to save the last position of the Spell Book.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SpellComparisonMax.Hi: Maximum number of spells that can be compared simultaneously (2-7)
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SpellLearningCostMult: Gold pieces per spell level required to learn spells (default: 50)
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SpellLearningTimeMult: Minutes per spell level required to learn spells (default: 120)
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SpellPreparationBonus: Bonus to the number of spells this class can prepare. Can be negative to reduce the base amount.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SpellSwapping.Hint: When this class can swap spells
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SpellSwapping.Label: Spell Swapping
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SpellcastingRuleSet.H: Choose the default rule set for spellcasting behavior across all characters
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SpellsPerLevel.Hint: Number of free spells gained per wizard level (default: 2)
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SpellsPerLevel.Label: Spells Per Level
SPELLBOOK.Settings.StartingSpells.Hint: Number of free spells a level 1 wizard starts with (default: 6)
SPELLBOOK.Settings.StartingSpells.Label: Starting Spells (Level 1)
SPELLBOOK.Settings.SuppressMigrationWarn: Migration warnings suppressed. You will no longer receive migration notification messages.
When enabled, migration warnings will not be shown in chat after the initial setup. Enable this if migrations are running repeatedly and you don't need the notifications.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Title: Spell Book Settings for {name}
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Troubleshooter.ActorD: This will export {count} actor(s) you own: {names}
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Troubleshooter.Import: This file contains {count} settings to import.
Successfully imported {imported} settings. {skipped} settings were skipped.
This will overwrite your current Spell Book settings. This action cannot be undone.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Troubleshooter.Menu.H: Generate a troubleshooter report to assist with issues.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Troubleshooter.Notes: The troubleshooter contains all relevant information needed to start the bug-squashing process. Using the buttons below, you can save this output as a file or copy it to your clipboard. Feel free to join the Discord or create an issue on Github.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Troubleshooter.Reload: Many settings were imported. A reload is recommended for all changes to take effect.
SPELLBOOK.Settings.Troubleshooter.Title: Troubleshooter
SPELLBOOK.SpellListChange.Confirmation: Do you want to proceed with this change?
SPELLBOOK.SpellListChange.Explanation: Changing the spell list for {className} will unprepare {total} spells that are no longer available in the new list.
SPELLBOOK.SpellListChange.Title: Confirm Spell List Change
SPELLBOOK.SpellSource.GrantedTooltip: This spell is granted by a feature or item and cannot be unprepared
SPELLBOOK.Spells.LockedNoSwapping: This spell cannot be unlearned once prepared
SPELLBOOK.Spells.LockedOutsideLevelUp: This spell can only be swapped during level up
SPELLBOOK.Spells.LockedOutsideLongRest: This spell can only be swapped during a long rest
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.00.Content:
SpellBook is a full-service spell management system for spellcasters. This tour will guide you through the core features of the SpellBook interface.
Use the arrow buttons or keyboard arrows to navigate through the tour. You can exit at any time by clicking the X button.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.00.Title: Welcome to SpellBook!
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.01.Content:
This is the main SpellBook interface. Here you can view all your character's spells, prepare them for use, and manage your spell slots.
The interface is organized by spell levels and provides quick access to all spell-related features.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.01.Title: The SpellBook Interface
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.02.Content:
If your character has multiple spellcasting classes, you'll see tabs on the right side. Each tab shows the spells available to that specific class.
Click a tab to switch between your different spellcasting classes, allowing you to prepare spells per-class.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.02.Title: Class Tabs
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.03.Content:
Spells are organized by level. Each level section shows the number of prepared spells per level, all available spells you can prepare, and spell details and metadata.
The arrow to the left of each spell header allows you to collapse the entire section.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.03.Title: Spell Levels
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.04.Content:
Use these checkboxes to prepare or unprepare spells. Prepared spells are ready to cast and appear on your character sheet.
Changes are tracked live but not saved until you click the Save button.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.04.Title: Preparing Spells
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.05.Content: These tags indicate spells that you have manually prepared. Prepared spells count against your preparation limit and can be unprepared by unchecking the preparation checkbox.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.05.Title: Prepared Spell Tags
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.06.Content: These tags indicate spells that don't count towards your preparation limits. Usually granted by an item, a subclass, feature, or background, etc. This includes At-will, Innate, Always Prepared, and Granted spells.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.06.Title: Other Spell Tags
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.07.Content:
This area shows your spell preparation limits: Current/Maximum prepared spells for each class and global preparation limit across all classes.
SpellBook automatically calculates your preparation limits based on your class and level. Note that this tracks preparation limits, not spell slots.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.07.Title: Spell Preparation Tracking
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.08.Content: Use filters to quickly find spells. Search by name, filter by school, level, and more, show only prepared or ritual spells, and use advanced search operators for power users.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.08.Title: Spell Filters
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.09.Content: Click the gear icon to customize which filters are visible. You can show or hide specific filter options to streamline your workflow and reduce clutter in the filter bar.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.09.Title: Customize Filters
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.10.Content:
Open the customization menu to personalize your SpellBook experience. Configure spell list display options, customize spell card appearance, set up quick-cast options, and manage spell grouping and sorting preferences.
These customizations are saved per-character.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.10.Title: Customization Menu
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.11.Content:
Click the Save button to commit all preparation changes to your character. Until you save, all changes are tracked locally and can be reverted.
Remember to save before closing SpellBook!
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.11.Title: Footer Button: Save
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.12.Content:
The Reset button reverts all unsaved preparation changes back to the last saved state.
Hold Shift while clicking to perform a full reset, which clears all preparations and returns to a clean slate.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.12.Title: Footer Button: Reset
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.13.Content:
Open the spell usage analytics dashboard to track most frequently cast spells, spell slot usage patterns, preparation history, and casting statistics over time.
Use this data to optimize your spell selections and preparation strategies.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.13.Title: Footer Button: Stats
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.14.Content:
Manage your spell preparation loadouts to quickly switch between different spell configurations. Save your current preparations as a loadout, load previously saved configurations, and right-click for quick-select menu.
Perfect for switching between combat, exploration, and social scenarios.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.14.Title: Footer Button: Loadouts
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.15.Content:
You now know the basics of SpellBook! Here are some recommended next steps. Try preparing some spells and clicking Save. Experiment with filters to find specific spells. Check out the Spell List Manager tour to learn about custom spell lists. Explore the Analytics dashboard to track spell usage.
For more advanced features, take the other available tours in the Tour Management window.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.15.Title: You're Ready to Go!
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.Description: Learn the fundamentals of using SpellBook for spell management
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Basics.Title: SpellBook Basics
SPELLBOOK.Tours.NoSuitableActor: No suitable actor found for this tour. Please create or select an appropriate character.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.00.Content:
Party spell coordination helps your group work together to prepare the most effective spell loadout. This feature shows which spells each party member has prepared and suggests spell synergies and combos.
This tour will show you how to use party coordination to optimize your group's magical capabilities!
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.00.Title:
Welcome to
Party Coordination
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.01.Content:
This button opens the Party Coordinator (only visible when your character is in a party or group). Left Click opens the full party coordination interface. Right Click opens a quick menu to toggle party mode display.
When party mode is active, you'll see small character tokens next to spells that other party members have prepared.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.01.Title: Opening Party Mode
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.02.Content:
The Party Coordinator shows an overview of all spellcasters in your group. You can see each party member's prepared spells and total spell coverage by level and school.
The interface updates in real-time as party members prepare or change spells.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.02.Title: Party Coordinator Interface
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.03.Content: This section visualizes your party's spell coverage. Schools of Magic shows which schools are well-represented. Spell Levels helps identify levels where coverage is weak. Spell Categories tracks damage, healing, control, utility, and more.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.03.Title: Spell Coverage Overview
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.04.Content:
Each party member can set their spellcasting focus using this gear icon. Click the icon to declare your magical role (damage, healing, control, etc.).
This helps coordinate party composition and avoid overlaps in roles.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.04.Title: Setting Your Focus
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.05.Content:
The Focus system helps parties coordinate magical roles. Choose from available focus options like damage, healing, control, utility, and more. SpellBook suggests spells matching your chosen focus. Party view shows the distribution of focuses, helping avoid too many healers or no crowd control.
You can change your focus at any time. The GM can customize available focus options in module settings.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.05.Title: Focus Options
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.06.Content:
SpellBook identifies powerful spell combinations across your party. Combo Setups shows spells that work well together (Web plus Fireball, Faerie Fire plus Attack Rolls). Buff Stacking identifies compatible buff spells that can be layered. Debuff Chains shows debuffs that synergize for increased effectiveness. Tactical Pairs highlights spells that enable powerful strategies.
When you see a synergy recommendation, coordinate with your party to ensure both spells are prepared!
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.06.Title: Spell Synergy Recommendations
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.07.Content:
Make the most of party coordination. Communicate by sharing this interface with your party during prep sessions. Diversify and aim for variety unless you have a specific strategy. Plan ahead by considering upcoming challenges when preparing. Be flexible and don't over-optimize; spontaneous play is fun too.
Party coordination is a tool, not a requirement. Use it as much or as little as your group prefers!
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.07.Title: Party Coordination Tips
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.Description:
Learn how to coordinate spell preparation across your entire party for optimal coverage.

Requires: Character must be in a party
SPELLBOOK.Tours.PartySpells.Title:
Party Spell
Coordination
SPELLBOOK.Tours.RequiresParty: This tour requires your character to be in a party. Please add your character to a party first.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.RequiresWizard: This tour requires your character to be a wizard. Please select a wizard character or create one.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.00.Content:
SpellBook offers extensive customization options to tailor spellcasting rules to your campaign. This tour will guide you through all the key settings to help you configure SpellBook for your table.
Click the wand icon in any character's SpellBook to open their settings.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.00.Title: SpellBook Settings
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.01.Content:
The SpellBook settings dialog is organized into two sections. Global Settings apply to all classes on this character. Class Sections provide one for each spellcasting class the character has.
Changes are saved when you click the Save Settings button at the bottom.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.01.Title: The Settings Interface
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.02.Content: Global rules default to the rules set in the module settings, but can be overriden per actor.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.02.Title: Global Rules Section
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.03.Content:
Choose which D&D edition's spellcasting rules to follow. Legacy Rules (2014) means cantrips cannot be changed once learned, stricter preparation rules apply, and traditional spell swapping on long rest. Modern Rules (2024) means cantrips can be swapped on level up or long rest, and more flexible spell preparation, and updated multiclass interactions.
This setting should match your D&D5e Rules setting.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.03.Title: Spellcasting Rule Set
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.04.Content: Control how SpellBook enforces preparation limits: Unenforced allows players to prepare infinitely. Allow+Notify notifies the GM if a player prepares over their set limits. Enforced will lock down the SpellBook UI when cantrips and levelled spells are at preparation max.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.04.Title: Enforcement Behavior
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.05.Content: Each spellcasting class gets its own configuration section. Each class has the same set of options available, but Wizards have additional configuration covered later.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.05.Title: Per-Class Configuration
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.06.Content: This setting controls whether cantrips are displayed and managed in SpellBook for this class. Automatically disabled by default for classes that don't typically have cantrips.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.06.Title: Show Cantrips
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.07.Content:
This advanced setting treats the selected class as a wizard with a spellbook. When enabled, the class gains a spellbook tab, can learn spells by copying them (with gold and time costs), and gains free spells on level up.
Useful for homebrew classes that use wizard-style spellbook mechanics (like some Artificer variants) or for campaigns where all casters use spellbooks.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.07.Title: Force Wizard Mode
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.08.Content: Controls when cantrips can be swapped: Never means cantrips are permanent once learned (2014 rules). On Level Up means cantrips can only be changed when the character levels up. On Long Rest means cantrips can be changed during any long rest (2024 rules).
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.08.Title: Cantrip Swapping
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.09.Content: Controls when prepared or known spells can be changed. Never means spells cannot be swapped once learned (for classes like Bard or Sorcerer). On Level Up means spells can only be changed when leveling up. On Long Rest means spells can be changed during long rests (for classes like Clerics or Druids).
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.09.Title: Spell Swapping
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.10.Content: Determines which spells can be cast as rituals. Only Prepared means only currently prepared ritual spells can be cast as rituals. All Known means any ritual spell the character knows can be cast as a ritual, even if not prepared (like Wizards). Never means the class cannot cast ritual spells.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.10.Title: Ritual Casting
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.11.Content: Each class needs a spell list assigned. No selection here will get SpellBook to try find the official class list. For best results, it is advised you select the specific spell list your player should pull from. You can add as many lists as you want, allowing you to enhance characters with subclasses, features, etc. that grant additional spells.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.11.Title: Custom Spell Lists
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.12.Content: Modify the number of spells a character can prepare. Spell Preparation Bonus lets you add or subtract prepared spell maximums. Cantrip Preparation Bonus lets you add or subtract cantrip maximums.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.12.Title: Preparation Bonuses
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.13.Content: Wizards have unique settings for their spellbook mechanics. Starting Spells controls how many spells a level 1 wizard starts with (default: 6). Spells Per Level sets free spells gained each level (default: 2). Learning Cost sets gold per spell level to copy spells (default: 50 gp). Learning Time sets minutes per spell level to copy spells (default: 120 minutes). These settings are hidden unless a wizard class is detected.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.13.Title: Wizard-Specific
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.14.Content: Enforcement should be left on Allow + Notify unless enforced is required. This allows players to get familiar with the UI while still informing the GM of mistakes. Setting a custom spell list will make sure they are learning spells from the correct sources.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.14.Title: Settings Best Practices
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.Description: Learn how to customize SpellBook settings for your players.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.Settings.Title: SpellBook Settings & Customization
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.00.Cont:
The Spell List Manager is a powerful GM tool for creating and customizing spell lists. This is perfect for modifying existing spell lists, creating homebrew classes and subclasses, managing campaign-specific spell restrictions, and curating spell selections.
This comprehensive tour will show you every feature of the Spell List Manager.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.01.Cont:
This is the Spell List Manager interface. It's divided into three main sections: the left sidebar contains all available spell lists, the center panel displays the selected list's spells, and the right sidebar shows available spells you can add.
Access it via the Spell List button on the compendium sidebar tab.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.02.Cont:
The left sidebar shows all spell lists in compendiums. This includes official class and subclass lists from dnd5e, custom lists you've created, and lists added by other modules.
Click on any list to view and customize it.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.03.Cont:
Click this button to create a brand new custom spell list from scratch. You'll be able to name your list, choose whether it's for a class or subclass, and start adding spells.
This is perfect for creating completely custom spell lists for homebrew content.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.04.Cont:
Click this button to merge multiple spell lists into one. You can combine as many lists at once as you need, drawing spells from many sources. This is useful for creating variant class lists or combining subclass spells with their parent class.
Merging creates a new list without modifying the originals.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.05.Cont:
Click on a spell list from the sidebar to begin customizing it. The center panel will display all spells in that list, organized by level.
You can view any list, but you'll need to click Edit to make changes.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.06.Cont:
The center panel displays all spells in the currently selected list, organized by spell level. The metadata displayed beneath each spell name can be configured using the Configure Display button in the footer, which will be reviewed later in this tour.
This gives you a complete overview of what's in each spell list.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.07.Cont:
When viewing a list, you'll see several important controls. The Edit button lets you modify the list's spells. The Rename button (which appears once a list has been customized) allows you to rename your custom version. The Open Class button (for class lists) opens the associated class item. The Add to Spell Registry toggle makes your list available to other modules and the Compendium Browser.
These controls give you quick access to common list operations.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.08.Cont:
Click the Edit button to enter editing mode. This allows you to add and remove spells from the list. Note that a Rename button will appear once you've customized the list, allowing you to give your custom version a unique name.
When you edit a system list, SpellBook automatically creates a custom version—the original list remains unchanged.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.09.Cont:
When editing, you'll see special controls with three key buttons: Restore from Source (if the original list has been updated) syncs your custom version with the latest changes from the source list. Delete Custom Version removes your custom modifications and reverts to the original list. Save saves your modifications to the custom version.
Always save your changes before closing the manager!
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.10.Cont: When editing a spell list, click the trash icon next to any spell to remove it from the list.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.11.Cont:
The Available Spells panel on the right shows all spells you can add to your list. Spells are organized by level and come from dnd5e system compendiums, module-provided spell collections, and custom compendiums you've created.
Click the plus icon on any spell to add it to your custom list.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.12.Cont:
Use the search and filter controls to find specific spells. You can search by spell name, filter by level, school of magic, casting time, range, and more.
These filters make it easy to find exactly the spells you need when building custom lists.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.13.Cont: Adding spells is simple—click the plus icon on any spell in the Available Spells panel to add it to your list. You can add as many spells as you want before saving your changes.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.14.Cont:
Selection Mode allows you to select multiple spells at once for bulk operations. Toggle this mode to enable checkboxes on each spell, then use the bulk action buttons to add them all at once.
This is perfect for making large-scale changes to spell lists quickly.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.15.Cont:
The footer center displays important statistics about the currently selected spell list. You'll see the total number of spells in the list and the source compendiums containing those spells.
This helps you track the size and composition of your spell lists at a glance.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.16.Cont:
The footer contains utility buttons: Configure Display lets you change what metadata appears beneath each spell name (similar to the Player Spell Book). Stats is a shortcut to the analytics dashboard. Help contains reminders for using the Spell List Manager, most of which are covered in this tour.
These tools help you work more efficiently with spell lists.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.17.Cont:
Tips for effective spell list management: Use descriptive names like "Artificer (Revised)" or "Nature Domain (Homebrew)". Test custom lists with characters before deploying them in your campaign. Remember that modifications create custom versions—the originals remain unchanged. Use the Registry toggle to make your lists available to other modules and the Compendium Browser.
For more details, join the Discord found in the Help button or on the GitHub page.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.Descrip: Learn how to create and manage custom spell lists for classes and subclasses
SPELLBOOK.Tours.SpellListManager.Title: Spell List Manager
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WelcomePrompt: Welcome to SpellBook! Would you like to take a quick tour to learn about the main features and how to manage your spells?
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.00.Conte:
Wizards have unique spellcasting mechanics that SpellBook handles automatically. You maintain a spellbook of known spells, learn new spells when you level up, copy spells from scrolls and other spellbooks, prepare a subset of known spells each day, and track gold and time costs for spell copying.
This tour will guide you through all wizard-specific features in SpellBook!
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.00.Title: Welcome, Wizard!
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.01.Conte:
Wizards get a special Wizard Spellbook tab in addition to their class spell tab. Class Tab shows spells you've learned and can prepare. Wizard Spellbook Tab shows ALL valid spells you can learn eventually from a set spell list, as well as scrolls you may pick up along your journey.
The spellbook icon differentiates this tab from your regular spell list. This is where you'll learn new spells and manage your growing collection!
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.01.Title: The Spellbook Tab
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.02.Conte: Think of your spellbook as a library, and prepared spells as the books you're carrying today. This tab will show you all class spells you could learn, scrolls you have in your inventory that can be studied, and spells you've already learned throughout your adventure.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.02.Title: Your Library
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.03.Conte: Click the Learn Spell button on any spell to add it to your spellbook. Free Learning (from leveling) is available based on your GMs rules. Paid copying costs time and money, with rules based on your campaign. These spells won't eat into your free spells you get from levelling up.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.03.Title: Learning New Spells
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.04.Conte: SpellBook tracks which spells were learned for free from levelling up, so this number will automatically decrement until the correct amount of free spells are learned. From this point on, until your next level up, you will have to spend the gold and time costs based on the level of the spell to learn more magic.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.04.Title: Free Spell Indicators
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.05.Conte: When you have spell scrolls in your inventory, the Learn Spell button icon becomes a scroll. Learning from the scroll allows wizards to expand their spells outside of their class limitations, or grant them extra spells while adventuring. The scroll is destroyed in the process.
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.05.Title: Learning from Scrolls
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.06.Conte: To prepare spells for the day, head back to the Class Tab and prepare based on what spells you've learned. Simple as that!
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.06.Title: Preparing Spells from Your Spellbook
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.Descript:
Master wizard-specific features including spell learning, copying from scrolls, and spellbook management.

Requires: Character must be a wizard
SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.Title: Wizard Spellbook Management
SPELLBOOK.UI.NotesPlaceholder: Add your personal notes about this spell...
SPELLBOOK.UI.ResetTooltip: Reset (Shift+Click to clear all prepared spells)
SPELLBOOK.UserData.AnalyticsDescription: View detailed statistics and patterns in your spell usage, opened via individual Spell Books or from the Journals tab
SPELLBOOK.UserData.AutoGenerated: This data is automatically generated and managed by the Spell Book module.
SPELLBOOK.UserData.FavoriteDescription: Mark spells as favorites for quick access
SPELLBOOK.UserData.IntroDescription: This journal tracks your spell usage, favorites, and notes. Data is automatically collected as you cast spells and can be viewed in the analytics dashboard.
SPELLBOOK.UserData.NotesDescription: Personal notes that apply to this spell across all your characters:
SPELLBOOK.UserData.PageDescription: This page tracks your personal spell notes, favorites, and usage statistics. Data is automatically updated by the Spell Book module.
SPELLBOOK.UserData.UsageDescription: Automatic tracking of spell usage in combat and exploration
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.InsufficientGold: Insufficient gold! You need {cost} gp but only have {current} gp.
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.LearnSpellPromptSuffix: and add it to your Spell Book?
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.LegacyCantripRules: Legacy Rules: Cantrips cannot be changed during a long rest.
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.ModernCantripRules: Modern Rules: You may swap one cantrip during a long rest.
SPELLBOOK.Wizard.SpellAlreadyKnown: This spell is already in your Spell Book.
SPELLMANAGER.Application.Title: Spell List Manager
SPELLMANAGER.Columns.AddSpellsPrompt: Select spells from the right panel to add them to this list.
SPELLMANAGER.Columns.EditPrompt: Select a spell list and click "Edit" to customize it.
SPELLMANAGER.Columns.NoListSelected: Select a spell list from the left column to view its contents.
SPELLMANAGER.Columns.NoSpells: This spell list contains no spells.
SPELLMANAGER.Confirm.Content: Are you sure you want to proceed?
SPELLMANAGER.Confirm.DeleteContent: Are you sure you want to delete the custom version of {name}? This cannot be undone.
SPELLMANAGER.Confirm.RestoreContent: Are you sure you want to restore {name} from the original source? Your customizations will be lost.
SPELLMANAGER.Confirm.Title: Confirm Action
SPELLMANAGER.CreateList.IdentifierNotes: An identifier can only contain lowercase letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), dashes (-), and underscores (_).
SPELLMANAGER.CreateList.MergedDescriptio: Merged spell list combining spells from {sourceList} and {copyFromList}
SPELLMANAGER.CreateList.SubclassHint: Mark this spell list as a subclass-specific spell list
SPELLMANAGER.CreateList.ValidationError: Invalid identifier format. Please use only lowercase letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Creation.Cont: Select a spell list from the left column. Click the "Edit" button to create a custom copy. Add or remove spells using the right panel. Click "Save" when you're done.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Creation.Step: Select a spell list from the left column.
Click the "Edit" button to create a custom copy.
Add or remove spells using the right panel.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Integration.C: When a player opens their Spell Book, the system will check if a custom version of their class spell list exists, use your custom version if available, or fall back to the original list if no custom version exists.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Modifying.Con: Custom lists will show additional controls:
Delete Custom Version: Remove your custom version.
Restore from Source: Reset the list to match the original.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Modifying.Not: If the original list has been updated since your customization, you'll see a notification.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Overview.Cont: The Spell List Manager allows you to browse, duplicate, and customize spell lists from compendiums. These customized lists can then be used by players in their Spell Book.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Practices.Ite: Create custom lists before your players create characters.
Test custom lists with dummy characters before using them in your game.
Keep a backup of important custom lists by exporting them.
Consider communicating list changes to players before making major modifications.
SPELLMANAGER.Documentation.Title: Spell List Manager Documentation
